Cool. Neat to see! 
Can we document the association names somewhere? 
Do we need to get https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/41468 in first? Then add to it ?

I have design doc for Dbus inventory association in EM. It will add  [containedby, contains] association for Redfish Chassis resource https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/43958
I think this document should be in the docs repo. I kind of think the doc should go in first before this change.
I will put this doc in openbmc/docs. This change looks up the association endpoints. Shall not have dependencies on the doc. When there is no such associations, the change does nothing.

Note, a similar document is https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/41468 
I also have seen these inventory inventory "links" many other places in bmcweb

> I will put this doc in openbmc/docs. This change looks up the association endpoints. Shall not have dependencies on the doc. 

I disagree. I think we need to get these documented first. At least up for review.
Agree with Gunnar, there's not a hard dependency, but this can't merge until we at least have the docs changes in review.

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/46806

Document the association forward and reverse name there.

Before this moves forward, I want to see the documentation move forward. Patrick left a comment. 

Can you also add this documentation to the commit msg?
nit: please put a Tested: header here.
Did this come from a real system, or is this just what you expect?  What other patches are needed to accomplish this?
this come from a real system with the entity manager patch https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/44196
Put in your commit message please.
Can we break these out into methods.  This function is already inordinately long.
This method is explicitly disallowed by name.  Please read COMMON_ERRORS.md
Because this is an object path, we should be loading this into an sdbusplus::message::object_path, and using the filename() method to get this information.
Please don't use auto in bmcweb.  use explicit types.  This isn't the only place that needs fixed.
This seems like a bad name for this.  Also, please follow the patterns used elsewhere, where this is set to a nlohmann::json& and explicitly set to an array.
This should probably call continue.  As written it will push an empty string into the list.

Maybe update the error message?

I think filename() can fail for many reasons. Maybe just say
```
"filename() is empty in " << upstreamChassisPath
```

Maybe update the error message?

I think filename() can fail for many reasons. Maybe just say
```
"filename() is empty in " << upstreamChassisPath
```

Same witht he other one with downstreamChassis

Use getProperty<std::vector<std::string>> instead.

You can use https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/44019 for reference.

Use getProperty<std::vector<std::string>> instead.
